道.definition: road; path (CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]); (bound form) way; reason; principle; (bound form) a skill; an art; a specialization; (Daoism) the Way; the Dao; to say (introducing a direct quotation, as in a novel); (bound form) to express; to extend (polite words); classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process; (old) circuit (administrative division)

道不同不相為謀.pinyin: dao4 bu4 tong2 bu4 xiang1 wei2 mou2
道不同不相為謀.definition: lit. persons who walk different paths cannot make plans together; to go separate ways (idiom)

道不拾遺.definition: lit. no one picks up lost articles in the street (idiom); fig. honesty prevails throughout society

道之所存，師之所存.pinyin: dao4 zhi1 suo3 cun2 , shi1 zhi1 suo3 cun2
道之所存，師之所存.definition: If sb has grasped the truth before you, take him as your teacher (Tang dynasty essayist Han Yu 韓愈|韩愈[Han2 Yu4]).; We should learn from one who knows the way.

道出.definition: to speak; to tell; to voice

道別.definition: to say goodbye; to bid farewell; to pay a farewell call

道卡斯族.definition: Taokas, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan

道場.definition: Taoist or Buddhist rite; abbr. for 菩提道場|菩提道场[Pu2 ti2 dao4 chang3]

道外.definition: Daowai district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1] in Heilongjiang

道外區.definition: Daowai district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1] in Heilongjiang

道奇.definition: Dodge, US automobile brand, division of Chrysler LLC

道孚.definition: Dawu county (Tibetan: rta 'u rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州[Gan1 zi1 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)

道孚縣.definition: Dawu county (Tibetan: rta 'u rdzong) in Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture 甘孜藏族自治州[Gan1 zi1 Zang4 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Sichuan (formerly in Kham province of Tibet)

道學.definition: Confucian study of ethics; study of Daoism; school for Daoism in Tang and Song times; Daoist magic; another name for 理學|理学, rational learning of Song dynasty neo-Confucianism

道家.definition: Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3] (369-286 BC)

道山學海.definition: mountain of Dao, sea of learning (idiom); learning is as high as the mountains, as wide as the seas; ars longa, vita brevis

道德經.definition: the Book of Dao by Laozi or Lao-Tze, the sacred text of Daoism

道拉吉里峰.definition: Dhaulagiri, mountain massif in the Himalayas

道指.definition: Dow Jones Industrial Average (abbr. for 道瓊斯指數|道琼斯指数[Dao4 Qiong2 si1 Zhi3 shu4])

道教徒.definition: a Daoist; a follower of Daoism

道格拉斯·麥克阿瑟.pinyin: Dao4 ge2 la1 si1 · Mai4 ke4 a1 se4
道格拉斯·麥克阿瑟.definition: General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war

道爾頓.definition: Dalton (name); John Dalton (1766-1844), British scientist who contributed to atomic theory

道理.definition: reason; argument; sense; principle; basis; justification; CL:個|个[ge4]

道真仡佬族苗族自治縣.pinyin: Dao4 zhen1 Ge1 lao3 zu2 Miao2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 xian4
道真仡佬族苗族自治縣.definition: Daozhen Klau and Hmong Autonomous County in Zunyi 遵義|遵义[Zun1 yi4], northeast Guizhou

道真縣.definition: Daozhen Klau and Hmong autonomous county in Zunyi 遵義|遵义[Zun1 yi4], northeast Guizhou

道真自治縣.definition: Daozhen Klau and Hmong autonomous county in Zunyi 遵義|遵义[Zun1 yi4], northeast Guizhou

道系.definition: (slang, coined c. 2017, contrasted with 佛系[fo2xi4]) Dao-type, a type of person who has traits associated with a Daoist approach to life, such as being active, optimistic, earthy and forthright

道縣.definition: Dao county in Yongzhou 永州[Yong3 zhou1], Hunan

道臺.definition: (Ming and Qing dynasties) daotai (title for an official responsible for supervising a circuit 道|道[dao4]), aka taotai and circuit intendant

道行.definition: skills acquired through religious practice; (fig.) ability; skill; Taiwan pr. [dao4 hang5]

道裡.definition: Daoli, a district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1er3bin1] in Heilongjiang

道裡區.definition: Daoli, a district of Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1er3bin1] in Heilongjiang

道高一尺，魔高一丈.pinyin: dao4 gao1 yi1 chi3 , mo2 gao1 yi1 zhang4
道高一尺，魔高一丈.definition: (idiom) as one climbs higher on the path of righteousness, one faces ever greater challenges from evil; no sooner does one overcome one obstacle than another arises

道高益安，勢高益危.pinyin: dao4 gao1 yi4 an1 , shi4 gao1 yi4 wei1
道高益安，勢高益危.definition: More moral strength increases one's safety, more power and influence increases one's danger (idiom, from Records of the Historian 史記|史记). cf Unlimited power is apt to corrupt the minds of those who possess it (William Pitt the Elder, 1770).
